intro: Justicia nematocalix, commonly known as the narrowleaf flamebeard, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking spikes of tubular, red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
